txt.en: From within a cleft nestling in the crags of Urugarth, Dushkal commands a host of trolls.
For years, the drake-matron has called the southern crags of Urugarth her home despite efforts to drive her from her roost.

This district of Carn Dûm, now called Urugarth, fell to ill-repair due to the foul waters pouring from the sewers of the seat of Angmar. Urugarth was given to the Orcs of Angmar and set as a staging point from which its terrible army could march.

Before the gates to Asht-Shâpol lies Lagmas'  Court. From here, the Uruk-captain Lagmas and his second-in-command Morthang rally and muster the forces of Urugarth as they prepare to march upon Eriador.
You have discovered the Urugarth Kennels
Winding their way down from the sewers of Carn Dûm, the viscous Fell-waters spill into Urugarth, poisoning the air and land around them.
The Warg-pack of Urugarth calls this valley home. Led by the goblin-keeper Athpukh and the Warg Lâmkarn, these Wargs are ready to hunt the hills of Angmar at a moment's notice.
Asht-Shâpol is the seat of power in Urugarth. Within the remains of this castle resides the Uruk-captain Lagmâs and his flock of deadly crebain.

This district of Carn Dûm, now called Urugarth, fell to ill-repair due to the foul waters pouring from the sewers of the seat of Angmar. Urugarth was given to the Orcs of Angmar and set as a staging point from which its terrible army could march.
